channel.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?
channel.description: I am thinking of starting up a mod to recreate the classic Pokémon games in source, 3d and everything like that, I was just curious if it would be worth my time. SO would any of you be interested in playing something like this?

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?

item.description:
i would be interested!

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?

item.description:

item.source: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?
item.dc:creator: Fnoigy
item.description:
Orpheon:

If Counter-Strike and sports games have taught me anything, its that people will buy more of what they like as long as SOMETHING is different…even if it’s just the packaging

Fixed that for you.

Pokémon games typically DO get a lot of additions between games, except that’s the problem. You can only add another 100 pokémon so many times before it just loses its meaning and/or you’re just adding useless fluff, and can only add so many game elements before the thing’s only enjoyable to the spergiest of sperglords who keep excel tables of everything. That’s why I generally don’t like Pokémon beyond the original R/B/Y. I’ve lately been trying to make myself play Gold/Silver again, but I’m just not really feeling the urge.

Read full topic
item.source: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
Aaagreen:

I’m 15, and I have that Pokemon Diamond thingy. Tbh, it’s gameplay is exactly the same as Pokemon Emerald that I played, I just don’t see why they keep releasing the same game in a different environment with one or two new sprites.

If Pokemon and sports games have taught me anything, its that people will buy more of what they like as long as SOMETHING is different…even if it’s just the packaging

Read full topic

I am thinking of starting up a mod to recreate the classic Pokémon games in source, 3d and everything like that, I was just curious if it would be worth my time. SO would any of you be interested in playing something like this?

Come back to me when you’ve finished.

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?
item.dc:creator: RM24
item.description:
Maxey:

Fuck them pokemans, Jingles I know you’re only like 14, but for the love of god, why do you like pokemon?

In fact, I think 14 is already way too old to still be liking them faggiemans.

I know people who are seventeen, sixteen, and fifteen-years-old and they still play games like Super Mario Galaxy 2 or Pokémon HeartGold Version.

And before anyone asks, yes, they do play games like Left 4 Dead 2, God of War 3, or BioShock 2. :hmph:

EDIT: ‘Tis a shame, Left 4 Dead 2 is the only Valve game they know about. :’(

Read full topic

item.title: Would you guys be interested in a Pokémon red/blue remake in source?
item.dc:creator: wheybags
item.description:
SoaringScout:

“Pussy out?” So basically you are saying that by playing on easy I’m not playing it completely? I’m just used to the gameplay of others games, considering how most of the FPS games I play have iron sights, so I suck against the combine and the millitary because I suck at aiming. I suck at the game, but that doesn’t mean I don’t feel I’m geting a good/full experience of the game.

Wait… I’m losing masculinity by playing on easy? :[

olololol faget

Jingles:

Stop hijacking my thread please…

Because it was just soooo awesome.

Read full topic
